meanings.definition: The number or group of people who watch a particular television program or film.
meanings.sent1: The viewerships for the new show were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The viewerships for the movie exceeded expectations.
meanings.sent3: The viewerships at the comedy club were so loud, they drowned out the comedian!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with excitement as she counted the viewerships in the theater.
meanings.sent5: The viewerships at the concert roared like a mighty ocean wave.

meanings.definition: The act of watching a television program or film.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the viewerships of the thrilling movie.
meanings.sent2: The viewerships of the show kept increasing every week.
meanings.sent3: The viewerships of the horror movie made her jump in her seat.
meanings.sent4: His intense viewerships of the game were like a laser beam focused on the screen.
meanings.sent5: The viewerships of the documentary were so captivating, she couldn't look away.
